hi and welcome to the X 22 report my
name is Dave and this is episode 1623
aan today's date of July 25th 2018 and
the title of the episode is everything
is being put into place for the economic
transition let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now we've been
talking about all different indicators
in the economy and how the economy's
falling apart
and we're starting to see now that there
are certain financial pundants that are
also taking notice now we saw this way
before and we were calling out the
housing market were calling out retail
we were called now the yield curve we
were calling out all the manipulation
the manipulation of unemployment the
manipulation of GDP the manipulation of
pretty much everything and housing is
very important because it leads into
many different areas of the economy to
many different sectors and what we're
seeing right now is the housing bubble
here in the United States it's popping
and it's not just popping here in the
United States it's popping in Canada
Australia Europe and right now Redfin
the CEO of redfin is saying that the
affordability crisis may have reached a
breaking point in Portland San Jose and
Seattle because of buyer fatigue Redfin
notes June home prices rose 5.7 percent
year-over-year smallest increase since
September 2016 the key point is buyer
fatigue now Redfin went on to say after
75 straight months of price increases in
these markets that far outpaced wage
growth homebuyers are now becoming
selective about which homes to buy and
at what price the percentage of listings
in these markets that sold within two
weeks declined in June from 61 percent
to 52 percent and the fraction of
listings that drop their price increase
from 31 percent to 33 percent we've seen
similar signs of buyer fatigue in the
past especially at this point in this
season but in the case the lull has
lasted a bit longer and affected more
markets than in the recent then in
recent past
once again signs are adding up that the
housing has
peeked this cycle and we've seen this
before where all of a sudden prices
start to come down sales start to drive
dry up traffic starts to dry up we saw
this prior to 2008 actually we saw it in
2006 going into 2007 and then it just
got worse
even though the Fed was out there the
mainstream media was out there telling
us that real estate was fine it was not
now we need to remember that interest
rates are starting to rise people are
losing their jobs people coming out of

lot of debt and this is a central
banking economy we hate we say there's
time and time again you cannot win
against a central bank economy because
the central bank economy is designed to
collapse it's designed to take the

see it in the middle stages but it's
really evident at the end stages and
this is why they need some type an event
or something to happen to cover up them
moving this entire system into something

the central bankers the bankers
themselves to get people in because once
you have too much debt you just have too
much debt you can't afford anything else
now colleges are doing something very
very interesting now we know there is
the student loan market has reached

before and most of the individuals
coming out of colleges they're having a
very difficult time finding those
high-paying jobs a lot of them can't

they've been working with these

well
a lot of individuals are saying well if

so colleges are now offering an
alternative to students who don't want

and for those who don't qualify for

job
well they'll defer it how long were they

you still are paying someone for this

now colleges are gonna just try to stay

they just realized that people just end

when the automobile industry first came

1500 2000 I think in the 70s around

what happened is as the value of the

the car and then cars

according to Moody's state federal and

private equity and a many other

many other pension funds have done the

remember the interest rates have been
